result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mari Marie Batton

records.addlTxt: Court orders defendant to JusticePoint supervision level 3

Defendant Mari Marie Batton in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Mari Marie Batton.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Defense counsel has offer but not full discovery and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court addressed JusticePoint discharge.  Court orders defendant to JusticePoint supervision level 3 and to report to JusticePoint immediately after court.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mari Marie Batton in court.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Joe Domask to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the conclusion of the case and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation (Missed Office Contact) Report
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Previous no contact order with CSH; SSH and TNM is continued by the court.

Defendant Mari Marie Batton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Mari Marie Batton. Attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation if released from custody.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mari Marie Batton not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court took no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Mari Marie Batton in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does NOT qualify for PD representation. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CSH (10/23/02); SSH (12/31/96); TNM (11/03/03)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mari Marie Batton in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Mari Marie Batton in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mari Marie Batton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mari Marie Batton
Current: 3047 N 6th St, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 07-08-2022)
Prior: 6766 West Appleton Avenue, #30, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
